AB.name: Alberta

sbd._note: Alberta small business rate: 2% on first $500,000 (effective July 1, 2020). The small business deduction is 6%, resulting in a net small business rate of 2%.

AB._note: Alberta administers corporate tax separately from CRA. Rates verified from official Alberta.ca source. Small business threshold is $500,000.

sbd._note: BC SBD: 2% on first $500,000 (uses federal limit)
Manitoba SBD: 0% (nil) on first $500,000 (uses federal limit)
NB SBD: 2.5% on first $500,000 (uses federal limit)
NL SBD: 2.5% on first $500,000 (reduced from 3% effective January 1, 2024, uses federal limit)

NS.name: Nova Scotia

sbd._note: NS SBD: 1.5% on first $700,000 (reduced from 2.5% effective April 1, 2025, limit increased from $500,000 effective April 1, 2025)

NS._note: Nova Scotia has rate and limit changes effective April 1, 2025. For full 2025 tax year, using post-April 1 rates.

sbd._note: NT SBD: 2% on first $500,000 (uses federal limit)
NU SBD: 3% on first $500,000 (uses federal limit)
Ontario SBD: 3.2% on first $500,000 (uses federal limit)

PE.name: Prince Edward Island

sbd._note: PE SBD: 1% on first $600,000 (limit increased from $500,000 effective July 1, 2025)

general._note: PE general corporate rate: 15% (reduced from 16% effective July 1, 2025)

PE._note: PEI has rate and limit changes effective July 1, 2025. For full 2025 tax year, using post-July 1 rates.

sbd._note: Saskatchewan SBD: 1% on first $600,000 (provincial limit differs from federal)

QC.name: Quebec

sbd._note: Quebec small business rate: 3.20% on first $500,000 (2025). Combined with federal 9% SBD rate = approximately 12.20% total.

general._note: Quebec general corporate rate: 11.50% (2025). Combined with federal 15% general rate = approximately 26.50% total.

QC._source: Invest Quebec - Taxation in Quebec 2025 publication
QC._note: Quebec administers corporate tax separately from CRA. Rates verified from Invest Quebec official publication. Quebec SBD threshold is $500,000 (same as federal) for 2025.

sbd._note: Yukon SBD: 0% on first $500,000 (uses federal limit)

_note: 2025 provincial corporate tax rates from official sources. Federal and most provinces: CRA source. Alberta: verified from Alberta.ca official tax rates page. Quebec: verified from Invest Quebec official publication. Some provinces have different SBD limits than federal ($500,000): Nova Scotia ($700,000), PEI ($600,000), Saskatchewan ($600,000). Some rates changed during 2025: Nova Scotia (April 1), PEI (July 1). For full 2025 tax year calculations, using post-change rates.
